alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Howell; Ozark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 9:22PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Ozark, eastern Douglas and Howell Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 922 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles southeast of Norwood to 20 miles north of Bakersfield to near Gainesville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West Plains, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Pomona, South Fork, Brandsville, Peace Valley, Pottersville, Siloam Springs, White Church, Sycamore, Vanzant, Dora and Zanoni. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Missouri.
